Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statements made about Dr. Fauci's comments on the coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the comments attributed to Dr. Fauci are accurate and true, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the comments attributed to Dr. Fauci, as it is stated that Facebook user Amy Wright actually wrote the comments and they were being misattributed to Dr. Fauci.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Dr. Fauci's official organization, NIAID, has stated that he has never used language like the comments attributed to him.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact and understanding of COVID-19 by stating that the full spectrum of symptoms and health effects is only just beginning to be cataloged and understood.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of faltering bias in the claim.
